document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine – Evaluation of Chronic Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Harding is being referred for evaluation of persistent fatigue, generalized malaise, and intermittent joint aches over the past 8 months. Despite initial workup and conservative management in primary care, her symptoms have persisted without clear etiology.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: Ms. Harding reports progressively worsening fatigue that interferes with daily activities. She describes non-restorative sleep, occasional headaches, and mild joint pain affecting her wrists and knees. There is no significant weight loss, fever, or night sweats. No recent travel or known infectious exposures.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: Asthma (well-controlled), seasonal allergies. No history of autoimmune disorders or major surgeries.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Albuterol inhaler as needed, loratadine 10 mg daily.

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: Vitals stable. Mild pallor noted. No synovitis or joint swelling. Cardiorespiratory and abdominal exams unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations to Date
sections.content: CBC: Mild normocytic anemia (Hgb 11.2 g/dL). TSH, renal and liver function, ESR, and CRP within normal limits. Negative ANA. Iron studies pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the chronicity of symptoms and inconclusive initial workup, internal medicine input is requested for further evaluation and management. Please advise regarding additional investigations or specialist referrals as indicated.
